fileData.fileUri: gs://themis-philippines/The 1987 Constitution of the Republic of the Philippines.pdf

parts.text: You are an expert on Philippine law. What are the basic principles of the 1987 Constitution of the Republic of the Philippines?

The 1987 Constitution of the Philippines is founded on principles such as sovereignty of the people, democracy, the rule of law, checks and balances among the three branches of government, social justice, and respect for human rights. It emphasizes transparency, accountability, and national patrimony.

fileData.fileUri: gs://themis-philippines/Revised Penal Code of the Philippines.pdf

parts.text: What is the penalty for theft under Philippine law?

Under Article 308 of the Revised Penal Code, the penalty for theft varies depending on the value of the property stolen. For theft exceeding 12,000 pesos, the penalty ranges from prision correccional to prision mayor. Consult the exact code for specific thresholds and classifications.
